item.title: Report E-2025010105
item.description:
Report E-2025010105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 8, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately the full contents to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025010357
item.description:
Report X-2025010357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: PICO RIVERA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF operation supervisor states that they unloading trailer 87402 in dock door 56 when they found a 3300lb metal tote of UN2920, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. (AMINE COMPOUND, METHANOL), 8(3), PG II, FLASHPOINT 56 C CLOSED leaking less than 1 fl oz from the top which would need a reseal or replacement tote in order to keep traveling. ABF supervisor states that he's not sure on how the top started leaking but assumes damage happened to the valve.

item.title: Report X-2025010407
item.description:
Report X-2025010407

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE SORT AISLE AT SPACE 48 USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE SLIDE, NO CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED TO THE SORT AISLE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED IT UP, THERE WERE 4-1GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF TECHSPRAY ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP, RESPONDER PROCESED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report X-2025010382
item.description:
Report X-2025010382

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF HAZMAT SPILL AT PENN 4 SPLIT 0530AM PST. HAZMAT RESPONDEDER DAWNED APPROPRIATE GEAR AND RESPONDED. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE REVEALED HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS WITH CORROSIVE DESIGNATION. PACKAGE OBSERVED WET ON TOP AND BOTTOM OF PACKAGING BOX. HAZMAT NOT SEEPING OUT OF SHIPPING CONTAINER. REMOVED HAZMAT FROM AREA NO SPILLAGE SEEN IN AREA. TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. OPENED PACKAGE AND OBSERVED CRACKED LID ON A 1 GALLON JUG. TESTED SOLUTION WITH A PH OF 11 PER COLOR CODED CHART. NEUTRALIZED HAZMAT USING SODIUM BICARBONATE IN ITS OWN PLASTIC CONTAINER. RETESTED SOLUTION 2 TIMES TO VERIFY A PH OF 6. USED A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH PLASTIC BAG AND ZEB ZORBENT AND WOODEN MIXING STICK TO SOLIDIFY SOLUTION. ONCE SOLIDIFIED PUT INITIAL PLASTIC BAG WITH SOLIDIFIED SOLUTION, GLOVES, STIRRING STICK, CARDBOARD PACKAGING, GLOVESS, AND PLASTIC JUG IN GREEN HAZMAT BAG. GOOSE NECKED BAG TAPED AND BEGAN HAZMAT PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025010089
item.description:
Report E-2025010089

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:10 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal UFV. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Pan Tint 61W862RS released from one 5-gallon metal jug due to being crushed while in transit due to improper packaging. The release impacted trailer #3110364. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 223403-1 was created, one 10-gallon poly drum containing 5-gallon metal jug, plastic wrap and cleaned up product. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024121300089 was given by Alex.

item.title: Report E-2025010079
item.description:
Report E-2025010079

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 27, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to remove all released paint. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010047
item.description:
Report E-2025010047

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: KETTLEMAN CTY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0708 ET, XPO-UKC notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 oz of Regular minerals spirits were released from a metal drum due to improper packaging The release impacted inside trailer#319-3264. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste was containerized into (1) 5-gallon poly drum including product, oil dri and gloves and left for terminal management to manage.
